name: id
desc: Component ID, not specified by default. If specified, it can be used to refer the component in option or API.

name: name
desc: Series name used for displaying in [tooltip](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#tooltip) and filtering with [legend](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend), or updating data and configuration with `setOption`.

name: legendHoverLink
desc: Whether to enable highlighting chart when [legend](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend) is being hovered.

name: coordinateSystem
desc:
The coordinate used in the series, whose options are:


+ `null` or `'none'`

No coordinate.




+ `'cartesian2d'`

Use a two-dimensional rectangular coordinate (also known as Cartesian coordinate), with [xAxisIndex](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.xAxisIndex) and [yAxisIndex](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.yAxisIndex) to assign the corresponding axis component.




+ `'polar'`

Use polar coordinates, with [polarIndex](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.polarIndex) to assign the corresponding polar coordinate component.




+ `'geo'`

Use geographic coordinate, with [geoIndex](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.geoIndex) to assign the corresponding geographic coordinate components.






+ `'none'`

Do not use coordinate system.

name: xAxisIndex
desc: Index of [x axis](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#xAxis) to combine with, which is  useful for multiple x axes in one chart.

name: yAxisIndex
desc: Index of [y axis](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#yAxis) to combine with, which is  useful for multiple y axes in one chart.

name: polarIndex
desc: Index of [polar coordinate](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#polar) to combine with, which is useful for multiple polar axes in one chart.

name: geoIndex
desc: Index of [geographic coordinate](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#geo) to combine with, which is useful for multiple geographic axes in one chart.

name: calendarIndex
desc: Index of [calendar coordinates](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#calendar) to combine with, which is useful for multiple calendar coordinates in one chart.

name: hoverAnimation
desc: Whether to enable the highlight animation effect of mousr hover node.

name: center
desc:
Center of current view-port.

Example:
```js
center: [115.97, 29.71]
```

name: zoom
desc: Zoom rate of current view-port.

name: layout
desc:
Graph layout.

**Options: **
+ `'none'` No any layout, use  [x](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.data.x),  [y](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.data.y) provided in [node](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.data) as the position of node.

+ `'circular'` Adopt circular layout, see the example [Les Miserables](graph-circular-layout).

+ `'force'` Adopt force-directed layout, see the example [Force](graph-force), the detail about configrations of layout are in [graph.force](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.force)

name: circular
desc: Configuration about circular layout.

children.name: rotateLabel
children.desc: Whether to rotate the label automatically.

name: force
desc:
Configuration items about force-directed layout. Force-directed layout simulates spring/charge model, which will add a repulsion between 2 nodes and add a attraction between 2 nodes of each edge. In each iteration nodes will move under the effect of repulsion and attraction. After several iterations, the nodes will be static in a balanced position. As a result, the energy local minimum of this whole model will be realized.

The result of force-directed layout has a good symmetries and clustering, which is also aesthetically pleasing.

children.name: initLayout
children.desc:
The initial layout before force-directed layout, which will influence on the result of force-directed layout.

It defaults not to do any layout and use [x](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.data.x), [y](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.data.y) provided in [node](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.data) as the position of node. If it doesn't exist, the position will be generated randomly.

You can also use circular layout `'circular'`.

children.name: repulsion
children.desc:
The repulsion factor between nodes. The repulsion will be stronger and the distance between 2 nodes becomes further as this value becomes larger.

It can be an array to represent the range of repulsion. In this case larger value have larger repulsion and smaller value will have smaller repulsion.

children.name: gravity
children.desc: The gravity factor enforcing nodes approach to the center. The nodes will be closer to the center as the value becomes larger.

children.name: edgeLength
children.desc:
The distance between 2 nodes on edge. This distance is also affected by [repulsion](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.force.repulsion).

It can be an array to represent the range of edge length. In this case edge with larger value will be shorter, which means two nodes are closer. And edge with smaller value will be longer.

children.name: layoutAnimation
children.desc: Because the force-directed layout will be steady after several iterations, this parameter will be decide whether to show the iteration animation of layout. It is not recommended to be closed on browser when there are a lot of node data (>100) as the layout process will cause browser to hang.

children.name: friction
children.desc:
> Since `v4.5.0`



It will slow down the nodes' movement. The value range is from 0 to 1.

But it is still an experimental option, see [#11024](https://github.com/apache/echarts/issues/11024).

name: roam
desc: Whether to enable mouse zooming and translating. `false` by default. If either zooming or translating is wanted, it can be set to `'scale'` or `'move'`. Otherwise, set it to be `true` to enable both.

name: nodeScaleRatio
desc: Related zooming ratio of nodes when mouse zooming in or out. When it is set as 0, the node will not zoom as the mouse zooms.

name: draggable
desc: If node is draggable. Only available when using force-directed layout.

name: symbol
desc:
Symbol of node of relation graph.



Icon types provided by ECharts includes
`'circle'`, `'rect'`, `'roundRect'`, `'triangle'`, `'diamond'`, `'pin'`, `'arrow'`, `'none'`






It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```


Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```





















If symbols needs to be different, you can set with callback function in the following format:
```js
(value: Array|number, params: Object) => string
```
The first parameter `value` is the value in [data](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-.data), and the second parameter `params` is the rest parameters of data item.

name: symbolSize
desc:
node of relation graph symbol size. It can be set to single numbers like `10`, or use an array to represent width and height. For example, `[20, 10]` means symbol width is `20`, and height is`10`.


If size of symbols needs to be different, you can set with callback function in the following format:
```js
(value: Array|number, params: Object) => number|Array
```
The first parameter `value` is the value in [data](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-.data), and the second parameter `params` is the rest parameters of data item.

name: symbolRotate
desc:
Rotate degree of node of relation graph symbol. The negative value represents clockwise. Note that when `symbol` is set to be `'arrow'` in `markLine`, `symbolRotate` value will be ignored, and compulsively use tangent angle.


If rotation of symbols needs to be different, you can set with callback function in the following format:
```js
(value: Array|number, params: Object) => number
```
The first parameter `value` is the value in [data](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-.data), and the second parameter `params` is the rest parameters of data item.
> Callback is supported since 4.8.0 .

name: symbolKeepAspect
desc: Whether to keep aspect for symbols in the form of `path://`.

name: symbolOffset
desc:
Offset of node of relation graph symbol relative to original position. By default, symbol will be put in the center position of data. But if symbol is from user-defined vector path or image, you may not expect symbol to be in center. In this case, you may use this attribute to set offset to default position. It can be in absolute pixel value, or in relative percentage value.

For example, `[0, '50%']` means to move upside side position of symbol height. It can be used to make the arrow in the bottom to be at data position when symbol is pin.

name: focusNodeAdjacency
desc: Whether to focus/highlight the hover node and it's adjacencies.

name: edgeSymbol
desc:
Symbol of two ends of edge line.

For example:
```js
edgeSymbol: ['circle', 'arrow']
```

name: edgeSymbolSize
desc:
Size of symbol of two ends of edge line. Can be an array or a single number.

For example:
```js
// Start symbol has size 5 and end symbol has size 10
symbolSize: [5, 10],
// All has size 10
symbolSize: 10
```

name: cursor
desc: The mouse style when mouse hovers on an element, the same as `cursor` property in `CSS`.

name: itemStyle
desc:
Graphic style of , `emphasis` is the style when it is highlighted, like being hovered by mouse, or highlighted via legend connect.




### color(Color|Function)=null

color.  Color is taken from [option.color Palette](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#color) by default.



> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```



Supports callback functions, in the form of:
```js
(params: Object) => Color
```
Input parameters are `seriesIndex`, `dataIndex`, `data`, `value`, and etc. of data item.

children.name: borderColor
children.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

children.name: borderType
children.desc: Border type, which can be `'solid'`, `'dashed'`, or `'dotted'`. `'solid'` by default.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

name: lineStyle
desc:
The style of edge line. [lineStyle.color](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.lineStyle.color) can be `'source'` or `'target'`, which will use the color of source node or target node.



### color(Color)= '#aaa'

Line color.





> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {

>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: width
children.desc: line width.

children.name: type
children.desc:
line type.

Options are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: curveness
children.desc: Edge curvature, which supports value from 0 to 1. The larger the value, the greater the curvature.

name: label
desc: Text label of , to explain some data information about graphic item like value, name and so on. `label` is placed under `itemStyle` in ECharts 2.x. In ECharts 3, to make the configuration structure flatter, `label`is taken to be at the same level with `itemStyle`, and has `emphasis` as `itemStyle` does.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element. Works when position is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc: Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

children.name: formatter
lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

children.name: rich
<style_name>
children.desc:
##### color(Color)="#fff"

text color.




If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









##### fontStyle(string)='normal'

font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`


##### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


##### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

##### fontSize(number)=12

font size.



##### align(string)=

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




##### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

```js
}
}
}
```




##### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

children.desc:
Label position, options：
+ `'start'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'end'`

children.name: formatter
lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.




### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

children.name: itemStyle
children.desc:
#### color(Color)=null

color.



> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: borderColor
children.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

children.name: borderType
children.desc: Border type, which can be `'solid'`, `'dashed'`, or `'dotted'`. `'solid'` by default.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: lineStyle
children.desc:
#### color(Color)= "#000"

Line color.





> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: width
children.desc: line width.

children.name: type
children.desc:
line type.

Options are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element. Works when position is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc:
Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.








#### color(Color)="#fff"

text color.




If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

font style.

+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`

+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


#### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

#### fontSize(number)=12

font size.

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




#### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:

If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js

// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

#### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js

```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or

If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








#### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

#### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

#### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

#### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.

children.name: rich
<style_name>
children.desc:
###### color(Color)="#fff"

text color.





###### fontStyle(string)='normal'

font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`


###### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


###### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

###### fontSize(number)=12

font size.



###### align(string)=

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




###### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




###### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



###### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



###### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

###### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

###### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

###### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

###### shadowBlur(number)=0

###### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

###### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

###### textBorderWidth(number)=0

###### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

###### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

###### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

###### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

name: categories
desc:
The categories of node, which is optional.
If there is a classification of nodes, the category of each node can be assigned through [data[i].category](~series-graph.data.category). And the style of category will also be applied to the style of nodes. `categories` can also be used in [legend](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend).

children.name: name
children.desc: Name of category, which is used to correspond with [legend](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#legend) and the content of [tooltip](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#tooltip).

children.name: symbol
children.desc:
Symbol of node of this category.



Icon types provided by ECharts includes
`'circle'`, `'rect'`, `'roundRect'`, `'triangle'`, `'diamond'`, `'pin'`, `'arrow'`, `'none'`






It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```


Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```

children.name: symbolSize
children.desc: node of this category symbol size. It can be set to single numbers like `10`, or use an array to represent width and height. For example, `[20, 10]` means symbol width is `20`, and height is`10`.

children.name: symbolRotate
children.desc: Rotate degree of node of this category symbol. The negative value represents clockwise. Note that when `symbol` is set to be `'arrow'` in `markLine`, `symbolRotate` value will be ignored, and compulsively use tangent angle.

children.name: symbolKeepAspect
children.desc: Whether to keep aspect for symbols in the form of `path://`.

children.name: symbolOffset
children.desc:
Offset of node of this category symbol relative to original position. By default, symbol will be put in the center position of data. But if symbol is from user-defined vector path or image, you may not expect symbol to be in center. In this case, you may use this attribute to set offset to default position. It can be in absolute pixel value, or in relative percentage value.

For example, `[0, '50%']` means to move upside side position of symbol height. It can be used to make the arrow in the bottom to be at data position when symbol is pin.

children.name: itemStyle
children.desc:
The style of node in this category.


#### color(Color)=null

color.  Color is taken from [option.color Palette](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#color) by default.



> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: borderColor
children.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

children.name: borderType
children.desc: Border type, which can be `'solid'`, `'dashed'`, or `'dotted'`. `'solid'` by default.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: label
children.desc: The label style of node in this category.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element. Works when position is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc: Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

children.name: formatter
lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




#### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js

// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.

```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








#### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




##### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








##### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








##### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

##### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

##### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

##### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

##### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

##### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

##### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


##### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









##### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

##### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

##### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

##### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

##### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

name: autoCurveness
desc:
For the situation where there are multiple links between nodes, the curveness of each link is automatically calculated.

When set to `number`, it indicates the length of the edge curvenness array between two nodes, and the calculation result is given by the internal algorithm.

When set to `Array`, it means that the curveness array is directly specified, and the multilateral curveness is directly selected from the array.

**Notice：** if [lineStyle.curveness](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.lineStyle.curveness) has been set, this property is invalid.

name: data

children.name: name
children.desc: Name of data item.

children.name: x
children.desc: `x` value of node position.

children.name: y
children.desc: `y` value of node position.

children.name: fixed
children.desc: If node are fixed when doing force directed layout.

children.name: value
children.desc: Value of data item.

children.name: category
children.desc: Index of category which the data item belongs to.

children.name: symbol
children.desc:
Symbol of node of this category.



Icon types provided by ECharts includes
`'circle'`, `'rect'`, `'roundRect'`, `'triangle'`, `'diamond'`, `'pin'`, `'arrow'`, `'none'`






It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```


Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```

children.name: symbolSize
children.desc: node of this category symbol size. It can be set to single numbers like `10`, or use an array to represent width and height. For example, `[20, 10]` means symbol width is `20`, and height is`10`.

children.name: symbolRotate
children.desc: Rotate degree of node of this category symbol. The negative value represents clockwise. Note that when `symbol` is set to be `'arrow'` in `markLine`, `symbolRotate` value will be ignored, and compulsively use tangent angle.

children.name: symbolKeepAspect
children.desc: Whether to keep aspect for symbols in the form of `path://`.

children.name: symbolOffset
children.desc:
Offset of node of this category symbol relative to original position. By default, symbol will be put in the center position of data. But if symbol is from user-defined vector path or image, you may not expect symbol to be in center. In this case, you may use this attribute to set offset to default position. It can be in absolute pixel value, or in relative percentage value.

For example, `[0, '50%']` means to move upside side position of symbol height. It can be used to make the arrow in the bottom to be at data position when symbol is pin.

children.name: itemStyle
children.desc:
The style of this node.


#### color(Color)=null

color.  Color is taken from [option.color Palette](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#color) by default.



> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: borderColor
children.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

children.name: borderType
children.desc: Border type, which can be `'solid'`, `'dashed'`, or `'dotted'`. `'solid'` by default.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: label
children.desc: The label style of this node.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element. Works when position is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc:
Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

text color.

###### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

###### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

###### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

###### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

###### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

children.name: itemStyle
children.desc:
##### color(Color)=null

color.



> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: borderColor
children.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

children.name: borderType
children.desc: Border type, which can be `'solid'`, `'dashed'`, or `'dotted'`. `'solid'` by default.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element. Works when position is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc:
Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.








##### color(Color)="#fff"

text color.




If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









##### fontStyle(string)='normal'

font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`


##### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


##### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

##### fontSize(number)=12

font size.



##### align(string)=

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




##### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




##### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








##### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








##### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

##### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

##### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

##### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

##### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

##### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

##### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


##### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









##### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

##### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

##### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

##### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

##### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

### tooltip

tooltip settings in this series data.

children.name: position
children.desc:
> **Notice：**series.data.tooltip only works when [tooltip.trigger](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#tooltip.trigger) is `'item'`.
The position of the tooltip's floating layer, which would follow the position of mouse by default. Options: + `Array` Display the position of tooltip's floating layer through array, which supports absolute position and relative percentage. Example: ```js // absolute position, which is 10px to the left side and 10px to the top side of the container position: [10, 10] // relative position, in the exact center of the container position: ['50%', '50%'] ``` + `Function` Callback function in the following form: ```js (point: Array, params: Object|Array.

backgroundColor

> **Notice：**series.data.tooltip only works when [tooltip.trigger](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#tooltip.trigger) is `'item'`.

children.desc:
> **Notice：**series.data.tooltip only works when [tooltip.trigger](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#tooltip.trigger) is `'item'`.
The floating layer of tooltip space around content. The unit is px. Default values for each position are 5. And they can be set to different values with left, right, top, and bottom. Examples: ```js // Set padding to be 5 padding: 5 // Set the top and bottom paddings to be 5, and left and right paddings to be 10 padding: [5, 10] // Set each of the four paddings seperately padding: [ 5, // up 10, // right 5, // down 10, // left ] ```

```js

}
```
```js
}
}
```

Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: lineStyle
children.desc:
##### color(Color)= "#000"

Line color.





> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: width
children.desc: line width.

children.name: type
children.desc:
line type.

Options are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: symbol
children.desc: Symbol of edge ends. Can be an array with two item to specify two ends, or a string specifies both ends.

children.name: symbolSize
children.desc: Symbol size of edge ends. Can be an array with two item to specify two ends, or a string specifies both ends.

children.name: ignoreForceLayout
children.desc:
> Since `v4.5.0`



Prevent this edge from force layout calculating.

name: edges
desc: Alias of [links](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.links)

name: markPoint
desc: Mark point in a chart.

children.name: symbol
children.desc:
Symbol of mark point.



Icon types provided by ECharts includes
`'circle'`, `'rect'`, `'roundRect'`, `'triangle'`, `'diamond'`, `'pin'`, `'arrow'`, `'none'`






It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```


Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```





















If symbols needs to be different, you can set with callback function in the following format:
```js
(value: Array|number, params: Object) => string
```
The first parameter `value` is the value in [data](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.data), and the second parameter `params` is the rest parameters of data item.

children.name: symbolSize
children.desc:
mark point symbol size. It can be set to single numbers like `10`, or use an array to represent width and height. For example, `[20, 10]` means symbol width is `20`, and height is`10`.


If size of symbols needs to be different, you can set with callback function in the following format:
```js
(value: Array|number, params: Object) => number|Array
```
The first parameter `value` is the value in [data](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.data), and the second parameter `params` is the rest parameters of data item.

children.name: symbolRotate
children.desc:
Rotate degree of mark point symbol. The negative value represents clockwise. Note that when `symbol` is set to be `'arrow'` in `markLine`, `symbolRotate` value will be ignored, and compulsively use tangent angle.


If rotation of symbols needs to be different, you can set with callback function in the following format:
```js
(value: Array|number, params: Object) => number
```
The first parameter `value` is the value in [data](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.data), and the second parameter `params` is the rest parameters of data item.
> Callback is supported since 4.8.0 .

children.name: symbolKeepAspect
children.desc: Whether to keep aspect for symbols in the form of `path://`.

children.name: symbolOffset
children.desc:
Offset of mark point symbol relative to original position. By default, symbol will be put in the center position of data. But if symbol is from user-defined vector path or image, you may not expect symbol to be in center. In this case, you may use this attribute to set offset to default position. It can be in absolute pixel value, or in relative percentage value.

For example, `[0, '50%']` means to move upside side position of symbol height. It can be used to make the arrow in the bottom to be at data position when symbol is pin.

children.name: silent
children.desc: Whether to ignore mouse events. Default value is false, for triggering and responding to mouse events.

children.name: label
children.desc: Label of mark point.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element. Works when position is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc: Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

children.name: formatter
lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```

```js
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or

If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.
