Show blur of the text block.

###### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

###### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


###### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









###### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

###### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

###### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

###### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

###### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element. Works when position is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc: Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

children.name: formatter
lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




##### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








##### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








##### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

##### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

##### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

##### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

##### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

##### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

##### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: rich
<style_name>
children.desc:
####### color(Color)="#fff"

text color.




If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









####### fontStyle(string)='normal'

font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`


####### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


####### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

####### fontSize(number)=12

font size.



####### align(string)=

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




####### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




####### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








####### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








####### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

####### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

####### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Shadow color of the text block.

Show blur of the text block.

Shadow X offset of the text block.

####### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: itemStyle
children.desc:
Mark point style.


#### color(Color)=null

color.



> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: borderColor
children.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

children.name: borderType
children.desc: Border type, which can be `'solid'`, `'dashed'`, or `'dotted'`. `'solid'` by default.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: data
name
children.desc: Mark point name.

children.name: type
children.desc:
Special label types, are used to label maximum value, minimum value and so on.

**Options are:**
+ `'min'` maximum value.
+ `'max'` minimum value.
+ `'average'` average value.

children.name: valueIndex
children.desc: Available when using [type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.markPoint.data.type) it is used to assign maximum value and minimum value in dimensions, it could be `0` (xAxis, radiusAxis), `1` (yAxis, angleAxis), and use the first value axis dimension by default.

children.name: valueDim
children.desc: Works only when [type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.markPoint.data.type) is assigned. It is used to state the dimension used to calculate maximum value or minimum value. It may be the direct name of a dimension, like `x`, or `angle` for line charts, or `open`, or `close` for candlestick charts.

children.name: coord
x
children.desc: X position according to container, in pixel.

children.name: y
children.desc: Y position according to container, in pixel.

children.name: value
children.desc: Label value, which can be ignored.

children.name: symbol
children.desc:
Symbol of mark point.



Icon types provided by ECharts includes
`'circle'`, `'rect'`, `'roundRect'`, `'triangle'`, `'diamond'`, `'pin'`, `'arrow'`, `'none'`






It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```


Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```

children.name: symbolSize
children.desc: mark point symbol size. It can be set to single numbers like `10`, or use an array to represent width and height. For example, `[20, 10]` means symbol width is `20`, and height is`10`.

children.name: symbolRotate
children.desc: Rotate degree of mark point symbol. The negative value represents clockwise. Note that when `symbol` is set to be `'arrow'` in `markLine`, `symbolRotate` value will be ignored, and compulsively use tangent angle.

children.name: symbolKeepAspect
children.desc: Whether to keep aspect for symbols in the form of `path://`.

children.name: symbolOffset
children.desc:
Offset of mark point symbol relative to original position. By default, symbol will be put in the center position of data. But if symbol is from user-defined vector path or image, you may not expect symbol to be in center. In this case, you may use this attribute to set offset to default position. It can be in absolute pixel value, or in relative percentage value.

For example, `[0, '50%']` means to move upside side position of symbol height. It can be used to make the arrow in the bottom to be at data position when symbol is pin.

children.name: itemStyle
children.desc:
Mark point style.

children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element. Works when position is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc:
Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.








##### color(Color)="#fff"

text color.




If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









##### fontStyle(string)='normal'

font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`


##### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


##### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

##### fontSize(number)=12

font size.



##### align(string)=

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




##### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




##### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








##### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








##### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

##### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

##### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

##### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

##### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

##### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

##### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


##### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









##### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

##### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

##### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

##### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

##### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

children.name: animation
children.desc: Whether to enable animation.

children.name: animationThreshold
children.desc: Whether to set graphic number threshold to animation. Animation will be disabled when graphic number is larger than threshold.

children.name: animationDuration
animationEasing
children.desc: Easing method used for the first animation. Varied easing effects can be found at [easing effect example](line-easing).

children.name: animationDelay
animationDurationUpdate
animationEasingUpdate
children.desc: Easing method used for animation.

children.name: animationDelayUpdate

name: markLine
desc: Use a line in the chart to illustrate.

children.name: silent
children.desc: Whether to ignore mouse events. Default value is false, for triggering and responding to mouse events.

children.name: symbol
children.desc: Symbol type at the two ends of the mark line. It can be an array for two ends, or assigned seperately. See [data.symbol](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.markLine.data.0.symbol) for more format information.

children.name: symbolSize
children.desc:
Symbol size at the two ends of the mark line. It can be an array for two ends, or assigned seperately.

**Attention: ** You cannot assgin width and height seperately as normal `symbolSize`.

children.name: precision
children.desc: Precision of marking line value, which is useful when displaying average value mark line.

children.name: label
children.desc: Mark line text.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether show label or not.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Positions of labels can be:
+ `'start'` starting point of the line.
+ `'middle'` middle point of the line.
+ `'end'` ending point of the line.

Since version 4.7.0, more label positions are supported: `'start'`, `'middle'`, `'end'`, `'insideStartTop'`, `'insideStartBottom'`, `'insideMiddleTop'`, `'insideMiddleBottom'`, `'insideEndTop'`, `'insideEndBottom'`.

`'insideMiddleBottom'` is the same as `'middle'`. Position is as the following chart.

The distance between labels and mark lines can be set with [label.distance](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-.markLine.label.distance).

~[800x500](bar-markline&reset=1&edit=1)

children.name: distance
children.desc: The distance between labels and mark lines. If it's an array, then the first element is the horizontal distance, and the second element is the vertical distance. If it's a number, then the horizontal and vertical distances are the same.

children.name: formatter
show
children.desc: Whether show label or not.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Positions of labels can be:
+ `'start'` starting point of the line.
+ `'middle'` middle point of the line.
+ `'end'` ending point of the line.

Since version 4.7.0, more label positions are supported: `'start'`, `'middle'`, `'end'`, `'insideStartTop'`, `'insideStartBottom'`, `'insideMiddleTop'`, `'insideMiddleBottom'`, `'insideEndTop'`, `'insideEndBottom'`.

`'insideMiddleBottom'` is the same as `'middle'`. Position is as the following chart.

The distance between labels and mark lines can be set with [label.distance](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-.markLine.label.distance).

~[800x500](bar-markline&reset=1&edit=1)

children.name: formatter
lineStyle
children.desc:
Mark line style.


#### color(Color)= "#000"

Line color.





> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {

children.name: symbol
children.desc:
Symbol of 0.



Icon types provided by ECharts includes
`'circle'`, `'rect'`, `'roundRect'`, `'triangle'`, `'diamond'`, `'pin'`, `'arrow'`, `'none'`






It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```


Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```

children.name: symbolSize
children.desc: 0 symbol size. It can be set to single numbers like `10`, or use an array to represent width and height. For example, `[20, 10]` means symbol width is `20`, and height is`10`.

children.name: symbolRotate
children.desc: Rotate degree of 0 symbol. The negative value represents clockwise. Note that when `symbol` is set to be `'arrow'` in `markLine`, `symbolRotate` value will be ignored, and compulsively use tangent angle.

children.name: symbolKeepAspect
children.desc: Whether to keep aspect for symbols in the form of `path://`.

children.name: symbolOffset
children.desc:
Offset of 0 symbol relative to original position. By default, symbol will be put in the center position of data. But if symbol is from user-defined vector path or image, you may not expect symbol to be in center. In this case, you may use this attribute to set offset to default position. It can be in absolute pixel value, or in relative percentage value.

For example, `[0, '50%']` means to move upside side position of symbol height. It can be used to make the arrow in the bottom to be at data position when symbol is pin.

children.name: lineStyle
children.desc:
Line style of this data item, which will be merged with `lineStyle` of starting point and ending point.

children.name: curveness
children.desc: Edge curvature, which supports value from 0 to 1. The larger the value, the greater the curvature.

children.name: emphasis
children.desc:
####### color(Color)= "#000"

Line color.





> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: width
children.desc: line width.

children.name: type
children.desc:
line type.

Options are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.name: curveness
children.desc: Edge curvature, which supports value from 0 to 1. The larger the value, the greater the curvature.

children.name: label
children.desc: Label of this data item, which will be merged with `label` of starting point and ending point.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether show label or not.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Positions of labels can be:
+ `'start'` starting point of the line.
+ `'middle'` middle point of the line.
+ `'end'` ending point of the line.

Since version 4.7.0, more label positions are supported: `'start'`, `'middle'`, `'end'`, `'insideStartTop'`, `'insideStartBottom'`, `'insideMiddleTop'`, `'insideMiddleBottom'`, `'insideEndTop'`, `'insideEndBottom'`.

`'insideMiddleBottom'` is the same as `'middle'`. Position is as the following chart.

The distance between labels and mark lines can be set with [label.distance](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-.markLine.label.distance).

~[800x500](bar-markline&reset=1&edit=1)

children.name: distance
children.desc: The distance between labels and mark lines. If it's an array, then the first element is the horizontal distance, and the second element is the vertical distance. If it's a number, then the horizontal and vertical distances are the same.

children.name: formatter
animation
children.desc: Whether to enable animation.

children.name: animationThreshold
children.desc: Whether to set graphic number threshold to animation. Animation will be disabled when graphic number is larger than threshold.

children.name: animationDuration
animationEasing
children.desc: Easing method used for the first animation. Varied easing effects can be found at [easing effect example](line-easing).

children.name: animationDelay
animationDurationUpdate
animationEasingUpdate
children.desc: Easing method used for animation.

children.name: animationDelayUpdate

name: markArea
desc: Used to mark an area in chart. For example, mark a time interval.

children.name: silent
children.desc: Whether to ignore mouse events. Default value is false, for triggering and responding to mouse events.

children.name: label
children.desc: Label in mark area.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element. Works when position is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc:
Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.








#### color(Color)="#fff"

text color.




If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









#### fontStyle(string)='normal'

font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`


#### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


#### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

#### fontSize(number)=12

font size.



#### align(string)=

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




#### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




#### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








#### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








#### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

#### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

#### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

#### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

#### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

#### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

#### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


#### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









#### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

#### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

#### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

#### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

#### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




####### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








####### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








####### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

####### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

####### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

####### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

####### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

####### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

####### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


####### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









####### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

####### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

####### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

####### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

####### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

children.name: itemStyle
children.desc:
Style of the mark area.


#### color(Color)=null

color.



> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: borderColor
children.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

children.name: borderType
children.desc: Border type, which can be `'solid'`, `'dashed'`, or `'dotted'`. `'solid'` by default.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

children.desc: Specify the left-top point.

children.name: type
children.desc:
Specify this item is on min or max or average value.

**Options:**
+ `'min'` max value.
+ `'max'` min value.
+ `'average'` average value.

children.name: valueIndex
children.desc:
Specify the dimension on which min, max, average are calculated,
available when [type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.markArea.data.type) used.
The value can be `0` (means xAxis, radiusAxis) or `1` (means yAxis, angleAxis),
using the dimension of the first axis by default.

children.name: valueDim
children.desc:
Specify the dimension on which min, max, average are calculated,
available when [type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.markArea.data.type) used.
The value can be the name of the dimension (for example, the value can be `x`, `angle` in line chart, and `open`, `close` in candlestick).

children.name: coord
children.desc: The format is [start coordinate, end coordinate], where the coordinate system can be `x`, `y` on [cartesian](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#grid), or `radius`, `angle` on [polar](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#polar).

children.name: name
children.desc: Name of the marker, which will display as a label.

children.name: x
children.desc: x value on screen coordinate system, can be pixel number (like `5`), or percent value (like `'20%'`).

children.name: y
children.desc: y value on screen coordinate system, can be pixel number (like `5`), or percent value (like `'20%'`).

children.name: value
children.desc: value of the item, not necessary.

children.name: itemStyle
children.desc:
Style of the item.
`itemStyle` of start point and end point will be merged together.

children.name: label
children.desc:
Label style of the item.
Label style of start point and end point will be merged together.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element. Works when position is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc:
Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

text color.

font style.

+ `'oblique'`


###### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


###### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

###### fontSize(number)=12

font size.



###### align(string)=

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




###### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element. Works when position is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc:
Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.








####### color(Color)="#fff"

text color.




If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









####### fontStyle(string)='normal'

font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`


####### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


####### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

####### fontSize(number)=12

font size.



####### align(string)=

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




####### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




####### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








####### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








####### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

####### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

####### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

####### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

####### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

####### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

####### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


####### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









####### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

####### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

####### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

####### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

####### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

children.name: type
children.desc:
Specify this item is on min or max or average value.

**Options:**
+ `'min'` max value.
+ `'max'` min value.
+ `'average'` average value.

children.name: valueIndex
children.desc:
Specify the dimension on which min, max, average are calculated,
available when [type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.markArea.data.type) used.
The value can be `0` (means xAxis, radiusAxis) or `1` (means yAxis, angleAxis),
using the dimension of the first axis by default.

children.name: valueDim
children.desc:
Specify the dimension on which min, max, average are calculated,
available when [type](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-graph.markArea.data.type) used.
The value can be the name of the dimension (for example, the value can be `x`, `angle` in line chart, and `open`, `close` in candlestick).

children.name: coord
children.desc: The format is [start coordinate, end coordinate], where the coordinate system can be `x`, `y` on [cartesian](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#grid), or `radius`, `angle` on [polar](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#polar).

children.name: name
children.desc: Name of the marker, which will display as a label.

children.name: x
children.desc: x value on screen coordinate system, can be pixel number (like `5`), or percent value (like `'20%'`).

children.name: y
children.desc: y value on screen coordinate system, can be pixel number (like `5`), or percent value (like `'20%'`).

children.name: value
children.desc: value of the item, not necessary.

children.name: itemStyle
children.desc:
Style of the item.
`itemStyle` of start point and end point will be merged together.


###### color(Color)=null

color.



> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: borderColor
children.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

children.name: borderType
children.desc: Border type, which can be `'solid'`, `'dashed'`, or `'dotted'`. `'solid'` by default.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

```js
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








######## borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.








######## borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

######## borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

######## padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

######## shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

######## shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

######## shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

######## shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


######## textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.



If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









######## textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

######## textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

######## textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

######## textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

######## textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show label.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: distance
children.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element. Works when position is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

children.name: rotate
children.desc:
Rotate label, from -90 degree to 90, positive value represents rotate anti-clockwise.

See: [label rotation](bar-label-rotation).

children.name: offset
children.desc:
Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.








####### color(Color)="#fff"

text color.




If set as `'auto'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.









####### fontStyle(string)='normal'

font style.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'italic'`
+ `'oblique'`


####### fontWeight(string|number)=normal

font thick weight.

Options are:
+ `'normal'`
+ `'bold'`
+ `'bolder'`
+ `'lighter'`
+ 100 | 200 | 300 | 400...


####### fontFamily(string)='sans-serif'

font family.

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ...

####### fontSize(number)=12

font size.



####### align(string)=

Horizontal alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'left'`
+ `'center'`
+ `'right'`



If `align` is not set in `rich`, `align` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
align: right,
rich: {
a: {
// `align` is not set, then it will be right
}
}
}
```




####### verticalAlign(string)=

Vertical alignment of text, automatic by default.

Options are:
+ `'top'`
+ `'middle'`
+ `'bottom'`



If `verticalAlign` is not set in `rich`, `verticalAlign` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
verticalAlign: bottom,
rich: {
a: {
// `verticalAlign` is not set, then it will be bottom
}
}
}
```

children.name: lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




####### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,

// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

children.name: animation
children.desc: Whether to enable animation.

children.name: animationThreshold
children.desc: Whether to set graphic number threshold to animation. Animation will be disabled when graphic number is larger than threshold.

children.name: animationDuration
animationEasing
children.desc: Easing method used for the first animation. Varied easing effects can be found at [easing effect example](line-easing).

children.name: animationDelay
animationDurationUpdate
animationEasingUpdate
children.desc: Easing method used for animation.

children.name: animationDelayUpdate

name: zlevel
desc:
`zlevel` value of all graphical elements in .

`zlevel` is used to make layers with Canvas. Graphical elements with different `zlevel` values will be placed in different Canvases, which is a common optimization technique. We can put those frequently changed elements (like those with animations) to a separate `zlevel`. Notice that too many Canvases will increase memory cost, and should be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid crash.

Canvases with bigger `zlevel` will be placed on Canvases with smaller `zlevel`.

name: z
desc:
`z` value of all graphical elements in , which controls order of drawing graphical components. Components with smaller `z` values may be overwritten by those with larger `z` values.

`z` has a lower priority to `zlevel`, and will not create new Canvas.

name: left
desc:
Distance between  component and the left side of the container.

`left` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`; and it can also be `'left'`, `'center'`, or `'right'`.

If the `left` value is set to be `'left'`, `'center'`, or `'right'`, then the component will be aligned automatically based on position.

name: top
desc:
Distance between  component and the top side of the container.

`top` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`; and it can also be `'top'`, `'middle'`, or `'bottom'`.

If the `left` value is set to be `'top'`, `'middle'`, or `'bottom'`, then the component will be aligned automatically based on position.

name: right
desc:
Distance between  component and the right side of the container.

`right` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`.

Adaptive by default.

name: bottom
desc:
Distance between  component and the bottom side of the container.

`bottom` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`.

Adaptive by default.

name: width
desc: Width of  component.

name: height
desc: Height of  component.

name: silent
desc: Whether to ignore mouse events. Default value is false, for triggering and responding to mouse events.

name: animation
desc: Whether to enable animation.

name: animationThreshold
desc: Whether to set graphic number threshold to animation. Animation will be disabled when graphic number is larger than threshold.

name: animationDuration
animationEasing
desc: Easing method used for the first animation. Varied easing effects can be found at [easing effect example](line-easing).

name: animationDelay
animationDurationUpdate
animationEasingUpdate
desc: Easing method used for animation.

name: animationDelayUpdate

children.name: position
children.desc:
> **Notice：**series.tooltip only works when [tooltip.trigger](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#tooltip.trigger) is `'item'`.
The position of the tooltip's floating layer, which would follow the position of mouse by default. Options: + `Array` Display the position of tooltip's floating layer through array, which supports absolute position and relative percentage. Example: ```js // absolute position, which is 10px to the left side and 10px to the top side of the container position: [10, 10] // relative position, in the exact center of the container position: ['50%', '50%'] ``` + `Function` Callback function in the following form: ```js (point: Array, params: Object|Array.

children.name: formatter
children.desc:
> **Notice：**series.tooltip only works when [tooltip.trigger](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#tooltip.trigger) is `'item'`.
The content formatter of tooltip's floating layer which supports string template and callback function. **1. String template** The template variables are `{a}`, `{b}`, `{c}`, `{d}` and `{e}`, which stands for series name, data name and data value and ect. When [trigger](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#tooltip.trigger) is set to be `'axis'`, there may be data from multiple series. In this time, series index can be refered as `{a0}`, `{a1}`, or `{a2}`. `{a}`, `{b}`, `{c}`, `{d}` have different meanings for different series types: + Line (area) charts, bar (column) charts, K charts: `{a}` for series name, `{b}` for category name, `{c}` for data value, `{d}` for none; + Scatter (bubble) charts: `{a}` for series name, `{b}` for data name, `{c}` for data value, `{d}` for none; + Map: `{a}` for series name, `{b}` for area name, `{c}` for merging data, `{d}` for none; + Pie charts, gauge charts, funnel charts: `{a}` for series name, `{b}` for data item name, `{c}` for data value, `{d}` for percentage. **Example: ** ```js formatter: '{b0}: {c0}
{b1}: {c1}' ``` **2. Callback function** The format of callback function: ```js (params: Object|Array, ticket: string, callback: (ticket: string, html: string)) => string ``` The first parameter `params` is the data that the formatter needs. Its format is shown as follows: ```js { componentType: 'series', // Series type seriesType: string, // Series index in option.series seriesIndex: number, // Series name seriesName: string, // Data name, or category name name: string, // Data index in input data array dataIndex: number, // Original data as input data: Object, // Value of data. In most series it is the same as data. // But in some series it is some part of the data (e.g., in map, radar) value: number|Array|Object, // encoding info of coordinate system // Key: coord, like ('x' 'y' 'radius' 'angle') // value: Must be an array, not null/undefined. Contain dimension indices, like: // { // x: [2] // values on dimension index 2 are mapped to x axis. // y: [0] // values on dimension index 0 are mapped to y axis. // } encode: Object, // dimension names list dimensionNames: Array, // data dimension index, for example 0 or 1 or 2 ... // Only work in `radar` series. dimensionIndex: number, // Color of data color: string, } ``` Note: the usage of encode and dimensionNames can be: If data is: ```js dataset: { source: [ ['Matcha Latte', 43.3, 85.8, 93.7], ['Milk Tea', 83.1, 73.4, 55.1], ['Cheese Cocoa', 86.4, 65.2, 82.5], ['Walnut Brownie', 72.4, 53.9, 39.1] ] } ``` We can get values that corresponding to y axis by: ```js params.value[params.encode.y[0]] ``` If data is: ```js dataset: { dimensions: ['product', '2015', '2016', '2017'], source: [ {product: 'Matcha Latte', '2015': 43.3, '2016': 85.8, '2017': 93.7}, {product: 'Milk Tea', '2015': 83.1, '2016': 73.4, '2017': 55.1}, {product: 'Cheese Cocoa', '2015': 86.4, '2016': 65.2, '2017': 82.5}, {product: 'Walnut Brownie', '2015': 72.4, '2016': 53.9, '2017': 39.1} ] } ``` We can get values that corresponding to y axis by: ```js params.value[params.dimensionNames[params.encode.y[0]]] ``` When [trigger](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#tooltip.trigger) is `'axis'`, or when tooltip is triggered by [axisPointer](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#xAxis.axisPointer), `params` is the data array of multiple series. The content of each item of the array is the same as above. Besides, ```js { componentType: 'series', // Series type seriesType: string, // Series index in option.series seriesIndex: number, // Series name seriesName: string, // Data name, or category name name: string, // Data index in input data array dataIndex: number, // Original data as input data: Object, // Value of data. In most series it is the same as data. // But in some series it is some part of the data (e.g., in map, radar) value: number|Array|Object, // encoding info of coordinate system // Key: coord, like ('x' 'y' 'radius' 'angle') // value: Must be an array, not null/undefined. Contain dimension indices, like: // { // x: [2] // values on dimension index 2 are mapped to x axis. // y: [0] // values on dimension index 0 are mapped to y axis. // } encode: Object, // dimension names list dimensionNames: Array, // data dimension index, for example 0 or 1 or 2 ... // Only work in `radar` series. dimensionIndex: number, // Color of data color: string, } ``` Note: the usage of encode and dimensionNames can be: If data is: ```js dataset: { source: [ ['Matcha Latte', 43.3, 85.8, 93.7], ['Milk Tea', 83.1, 73.4, 55.1], ['Cheese Cocoa', 86.4, 65.2, 82.5], ['Walnut Brownie', 72.4, 53.9, 39.1] ] } ``` We can get values that corresponding to y axis by: ```js params.value[params.encode.y[0]] ``` If data is: ```js dataset: { dimensions: ['product', '2015', '2016', '2017'], source: [ {product: 'Matcha Latte', '2015': 43.3, '2016': 85.8, '2017': 93.7}, {product: 'Milk Tea', '2015': 83.1, '2016': 73.4, '2017': 55.1}, {product: 'Cheese Cocoa', '2015': 86.4, '2016': 65.2, '2017': 82.5}, {product: 'Walnut Brownie', '2015': 72.4, '2016': 53.9, '2017': 39.1} ] } ``` We can get values that corresponding to y axis by: ```js params.value[params.dimensionNames[params.encode.y[0]]] ``` **Note: **Using array to present all the parameters in ECharts 2.x is not supported anymore. The second parameter `ticket` is the asynchronous callback flag which should be used along with the third parameter `callback` when it is used. The third parameter `callback` is asynchronous callback. When the content of tooltip is acquired asynchronously, `ticket` and `htm` as introduced above can be used to update tooltip with callback. Example: ```js formatter: function (params, ticket, callback) { $.get('detail?name=' + params.name, function (content) { callback(ticket, toHTML(content)); }); return 'Loading'; } ```

> **Notice：**series.tooltip only works when [tooltip.trigger](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#tooltip.trigger) is `'item'`.
The floating layer of tooltip space around content. The unit is px. Default values for each position are 5. And they can be set to different values with left, right, top, and bottom. Examples: ```js // Set padding to be 5 padding: 5 // Set the top and bottom paddings to be 5, and left and right paddings to be 10 padding: [5, 10] // Set each of the four paddings seperately padding: [ 5, // up 10, // right 5, // down 10, // left ] ```

Can also be 'serif' , 'monospace', ... #### fontSize(number)=14 font size.

children.name: extraCssText
children.desc:
> **Notice：**series.tooltip only works when [tooltip.trigger](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#tooltip.trigger) is `'item'`.
Extra CSS style for floating layer. The following is an example for adding shadow. ```js extraCssText: 'box-shadow: 0 0 3px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);' ```
